body.p: The Indian reporter still in the hospital. Dr. Winter told he is alright now so he will be out this week some time. Mr. and Mrs. Adam Thunder Cloud were here last week at Indian hospital to see some sick people. Mr. and Mrs. Allen Decorah and Mr. and Mrs. Joe Green were here last week. Alvin Stacy, William Waukon and Lester Young Thunder were here last Monday. Mrs. D. W. Decorah and Bertha Johnson were here last Sunday to see Charles R. Lowe Cloud and he told them he is alright now, he will he will be out this week some time. Tom Harrison of Winnebago, Nebraska, was here last Wednesday at Indian Mission, came after his wife, Mrs. Lillian Johnson Harrison. There are three Indian girls working here in the hospital, are always faithful their duties, as following- Irene Miller, Evelyn Murie and Jessie Marmon, and some other too but we donâ€™t know the name, and they are all know what they are doing. One of newspaper sent from Hoopeston, Ill., this paper called Chronicle Herald. He will take the Indian news too. Perhaps that town old Indian town too, and says, here is our Indian friend here again.While the Indian reporter staying at Tomah Indian hospital he had lot of letters from everywhere. The reader of Banner-Journal they want him to hurry up to get well. One of these from Mr. and Mrs. Henry Rundle of Humbird, Wis.
